name: df-setc
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6
body: |- wceq(csetc, cmpt(s0, universe, ctp(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), cv(s0)), cop(cfv(chom, cnx), cmpo(s1, s2, cv(s0), cv(s0), co(cv(s2), cmap, cv(s1)))), cop(cfv(cco, cnx), cmpo(s3, s4, cxp(cv(s0), cv(s0)), cv(s0), cmpo(s5, s6, co(cv(s4), cmap, cfv(c2nd, cv(s3))), co(cfv(c2nd, cv(s3)), cmap, cfv(c1st, cv(s3))), ccom(cv(s5), cv(s6))))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ SetCat =(s0 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶ { <(Base ` ndx), s0 >, <(Hom ` ndx),(s1 ‚àà s0, s2 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶(s2[‚Ü¶]s1))>, <(comp ` ndx),(s3 ‚àà(s0 √ó s0), s4 ‚àà s0 ‚Ü¶(s5 ‚àà(s4[‚Ü¶](2nd ` s3)), s6 ‚àà((2nd ` s3)[‚Ü¶](1st ` s3))‚Ü¶(s5 ‚àò s6)))> })
comment: Definition of the category Set, relativized to a subset ` u ` . Example 3.3(1) of [Adamek] p. 22. This is the category of all sets in ` u ` and functions between these sets. Generally, we will take ` u ` to be a weak universe or Grothendieck universe, because these sets have closure properties as good as the real thing. (Contributed by FL, 8-Nov-2013.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Jan-2017.)
